text: Thomas Luttrell (1584–1644) of Dunster Castle, British (English) School, National Trust, Dunster Castle collection. Donated in 1981 by Lieutenant- Colonel Geoffrey Walter Fownes Luttrell (1919–2007) Thomas Luttrell (1583–1644) was an English politician from Dunster Castle in Somerset. In 1625 he sat in the Useless Parliament as a Member of Parliament (MP) for his family's pocket borough of Minehead. Lutrell was the oldest of George Luttrell of Dunster Castle. He was educated at Lincoln College, Oxford and at Lincoln's Inn. He had inherited seven manors in north-west Somerset, and held numerous public offices in the county including Deputy Lieutenant from 1629 to at least 1640, and Sheriff in 1631–32. Thomas Luttrell married Jane Popham, daughter of Sir Francis Popham and his wife Ann Dudley and together they had three known children, George, Francis and Thomas. == See also == * Feudal barony of Dunster == References == Category:1583 births Category:1644 deaths Thomas Category:English MPs 1625 Category:Alumni of Lincoln College, Oxford Category:Members of Lincoln's Inn Category:Deputy Lieutenants of Somerset Category:High Sheriffs of Somerset
title: Thomas Luttrell (1583–1644)
